[[File:Hemianopsia.jpg|left|vignette|Goldman visual field showing left lateral homonymous hemianopia (top), and right lateral homonymous hemianopia (bottom). The diagrams represent what the patient sees (visual field of the right eye on the right, visual field of the left eye on the left)].

question.title: What is the term for the visual field defect characterized by a loss of vision on one side of both eyes?
question.description: A visual field defect that affects both eyes

option_a.title: Bitemporal hemianopia
option_a.description: A visual field defect that affects the outer half of both visual fields

option_b.title: Lateral hemianopia
option_b.description: A visual field defect that affects one half of both visual fields

option_c.title: Quadranopsia
option_c.description: A visual field defect that affects one quarter of both visual fields

option_d.title: Monocular vision loss
option_d.description: A loss of vision in one eye only

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The letter of the correct answer
